result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy C Mchatten Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department., Second half jail sentence can be on electronic monitor, if eligible according to jail rules, can transfer to another county jail if can be arranged and approved - stayed

miscConds.notes: Per Order filed on 08/29/16 - Restitution due is $0.00

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with Jim Laabs music or Kohls.

Apology letter to Jim Laabs, give to Agent first.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final
Count 1
Count 1

Defendant Timothy C Mchatten in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 16CF49 and 16CF110. Amended informations are filed for each each case.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF49 Count 1: Guilty
16CF110 Count 1: Guilty
16CF110 Count 2: Guilty
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF49 Count 1, 16CF110 Count 1, and 16CF110 Count 2:.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Constable makes sentencing recommendation to the Court. 
Atty Renc concurs with joint recommendation and request expungement. 
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***
16CF49 Count 1: I/S Sentence: 30 days jail - huber, second half on electronic monitor, if eligible according to jail rules, can transfer to another county jail if can be arranged and approved - stayed - 2 days credit
12 months Probation
Conditions:
Pay costs & DNA surcharge.
No contact with Jim Laabs music or Kohls
Apology letter to Jim Laabs, give to Agent first.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay restitution to be determined in 30 days.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
Expungment if successfully completed.

16CF110 Count 1: I/S Sentence: 60 days jail, concurrent - stayed
12 months Probation
Conditions: Same conditions as stated in 16CF49.

16CF110 Count 2:  I/S Sentence: 90 days jail, concurrent - stayed - 2 days credit
12 months Probation
Conditions: Same conditions as stated in 16CF49.
